Package game

Interface GameDriver

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    RummyDriver
    public interface GameDriver
    An interface that creates game-specific players and options. Used in initializing a game using a DriverEngine.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Game createLocalGame​(int numPlayers)
      Creates a game with a specified number of players.
      GamePlayer createLocalPlayer​(java.lang.String name)
      Creates a player that to play the game.
      Game createRemoteGame​(java.lang.String hostName)
      Creates a "proxy" game that acts as an intermediary between a local player and a game that is somewhere else on the net.
      ProxyPlayer createRemotePlayer()
      Creates a "proxy" player that acts as an intermediary between a local game and a player somewhere else on the internet.
      java.lang.String[] localPlayerChoices()
      Returns a array containing the names of players from which a selection should be made.

    • Method Detail

      • localPlayerChoices

        java.lang.String[] localPlayerChoices()
        Returns a array containing the names of players from which a selection should be made. Typically there will be a human player (i.e., a GUI that allows a human to play the game), and one or more computer (i.e., automated) players.
        Returns:
        String-array containing the names of (GUI and automated) players that are available to play the game.

      • createLocalPlayer

        GamePlayer createLocalPlayer​(java.lang.String name)
        Creates a player that to play the game.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the player. (This should be one of the names returned by localPlayerChoices.)
        Returns:
        A new player for the game.

      • createRemotePlayer

        ProxyPlayer createRemotePlayer()
        Creates a "proxy" player that acts as an intermediary between a local game and a player somewhere else on the internet.
        Returns:
        a "proxy" player that passes information between the game and a "real" player somewhere else on the net.

      • createRemoteGame

        Game createRemoteGame​(java.lang.String hostName)
        Creates a "proxy" game that acts as an intermediary between a local player and a game that is somewhere else on the net.
        Parameters:
        hostName - the name of the machine where the game resides.
        Returns:
        a "dummy" game that passes information between the player and a "real" game somewhere else on the net.

      • createLocalGame

        Game createLocalGame​(int numPlayers)
        Creates a game with a specified number of players. Once the game and players are created, the game's setPlayers method should be used to tell the game who the players are.
        Parameters:
        numPlayers - The number of players that will be playing in this game.
        Returns:
        a new game, which does not yet have any players.
